   21: 
   22: -module(http_format_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include("http_internal.hrl").
   26: 
   27: %% Note: This directive should only be used in test suites.
   28: -compile(export_all).
   29: 
   30: all() -> 
   31:     [{group, chunk}, http_response, http_request,
   32:      validate_request_line, {group, script}, is_absolut_uri,
   33:      convert_netscapecookie_date, check_content_length_encoding].
   34: 
   35: groups() -> 
   36:     [{script, [], [esi_parse_headers, cgi_parse_headers]},
   37:      {chunk, [],
   38:       [chunk_decode, chunk_encode, chunk_extensions_otp_6005,
   39:        chunk_decode_otp_6264,
   40:        chunk_decode_empty_chunk_otp_6511,
   41:        chunk_whitespace_suffix,
   42:        chunk_decode_trailer, chunk_max_headersize, chunk_max_bodysize, chunk_not_hex]}].
   43: 
   44: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   45:     Config.
   46: 
   47: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   48:     ok.
   49: 
   50: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   54:     Config.
   55: 
   56: 
   57: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_testcase(_, _) ->
   61:     ok.
   62: 
   63: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   64: %% Test cases starts here.
   65: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   66: 
   67: chunk_decode() ->
   68:     [{doc, "Test http_chunk:decode/3"}].
   69: chunk_decode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     ReqHeaders =  #http_request_h{'transfer-encoding' = "chunked"},
   71:     ChunkedBody = "A" ++ ?CRLF ++ "1234567890" ++ ?CRLF ++ "4" ++
   72: 	?CRLF ++ "HEJ!" ++ ?CRLF ++ "0" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF,    
   73:     {ok, {Headers, Body}} = 
   74: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
   75: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
   76:     "1234567890HEJ!"  = binary_to_list(Body),
   77:     %% When the "chunked" is removed by the decoding the header
   78:     %% will become empty in this case i.e. undefined!
   79:     NewReqHeaders = http_chunk:handle_headers(ReqHeaders, Headers),
   80:     undefined = NewReqHeaders#http_request_h.'transfer-encoding',
   81: 
   82:     NewChunkedBody = ["A" ++ [?CR], [?LF] ++ "12345", "67890" ++ ?CRLF ++ "4"
   83: 		      ++ ?CRLF ++ "HEJ!" ++ ?CRLF ++ "0" ++ [?CR], 
   84: 		      [?LF, ?CR, ?LF]], 
   85: 
   86:     {Module, Function, Args} = 
   87: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(hd(NewChunkedBody)),
   88: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
   89: 
   90:     {_, Body} = parse(Module, Function, Args, tl(NewChunkedBody)),
   91:     "1234567890HEJ!" = binary_to_list(Body).
   92: 
   93: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   94: chunk_extensions_otp_6005() ->
   95:     [{doc, "Make sure so called extensions are ignored"}].
   96: chunk_extensions_otp_6005(Config) when is_list(Config)->
   97:     ChunkedBody = "A;ignore this" ++ ?CRLF ++ "1234567890" ++
   98: 	?CRLF ++ "4" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "HEJ!"++ ?CRLF  ++ "0" ++
   99: 	";extensionname=extensionvalue;foo=bar" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF,
  100:      {ok, {["content-length:14"], Body}} = 
  101: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  102: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  103: 	"1234567890HEJ!"  = binary_to_list(Body),
  104: 
  105:     ChunkedBody1 = ["A;", "ignore this" ++ [?CR], [?LF] ++ "1234567890" ++
  106: 		    ?CRLF ++ "4" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "HEJ!"++ ?CRLF  ++ "0" ++
  107: 		    ";extensionname=extensionvalue;foo=bar" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF],
  108:     
  109:     {Module1, Function1, Args1} = 
  110: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(hd(ChunkedBody1)),
  111: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  112:     
  113:     {_, NewBody} = parse(Module1, Function1, Args1, tl(ChunkedBody1)),
  114:     "1234567890HEJ!" = binary_to_list(NewBody).
  115: 
  116: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  117: chunk_decode_otp_6264() ->
  118:     [{doc, "Check that 0 in the body does not count as the last chunk"}].
  119: chunk_decode_otp_6264(Config) when is_list(Config)->
  120:     ChunkedBody = "A;ignore this" ++ ?CRLF ++ "1234567890" ++
  121: 	?CRLF ++ "4" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "0123"++ ?CRLF  ++ "0" ++
  122: 	";extensionname=extensionvalue;foo=bar" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF,
  123:      {ok, {["content-length:14"], Body}} = 
  124: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  125: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  126: 	"12345678900123"  = binary_to_list(Body),
  127: 
  128:      NewChunkedBody = ["A" ++ [?CR], [?LF] ++ "12345", "67890" ++ ?CRLF ++ "1"
  129: 		      ++ ?CRLF ++ "0" ++ ?CRLF ++ "0" ++ [?CR], 
  130: 		      [?LF, ?CR, ?LF]],
  131: 
  132:     {Module, Function, Args} = 
  133: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(hd(NewChunkedBody)),
  134: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  135:     
  136:     {_, NewBody} = parse(Module, Function, Args, tl(NewChunkedBody)),
  137:     "12345678900" = binary_to_list(NewBody),
  138:     
  139:     NewChunkedBody1 = ["A" ++ [?CR], [?LF] ++ "12345", "67890" ++ ?CRLF ++ "1"
  140: 		      ++ ?CRLF ++ "0", ?CRLF ++ "0", [?CR], [?LF], 
  141: 		      [?CR], [?LF]],
  142: 
  143:     {Module1, Function1, Args1} = 
  144: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(hd(NewChunkedBody1)),
  145: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  146:     
  147:     {_, NewBody} = parse(Module1, Function1, Args1, tl(NewChunkedBody1)),
  148:     "12345678900" = binary_to_list(NewBody).
  149: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  150: chunk_decode_empty_chunk_otp_6511(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  151:     ChunkedBody = "0" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF,
  152:     {ok,{["content-length:0"],<<>>}}  = 
  153: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  154: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE).
  155:     
  156: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  157: chunk_whitespace_suffix() ->
  158:     [{doc, "Test whitespace after chunked length header"}].
  159: chunk_whitespace_suffix(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  160:     ChunkedBody = "1a  ; ignore-stuff-here" ++ ?CRLF ++
  161: 	"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz" ++ ?CRLF ++ "10   "  ++ ?CRLF
  162: 	++ "1234567890abcdef" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "0  " ++ ?CRLF
  163: 	++ "some-footer:some-value"  ++ ?CRLF
  164: 	++ "another-footer:another-value" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF,
  165:     {ok, {["content-length:42", "another-footer:another-value",
  166: 	   "some-footer:some-value", ""],
  167: 	  <<"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz1234567890abcdef">>}} =
  168: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  169: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE).
  170: 
  171: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  172: chunk_decode_trailer() ->
  173:     [{doc,"Make sure trailers are handled correctly. Trailers should"
  174:      "become new headers"}].
  175: chunk_decode_trailer(Config) when is_list(Config)->
  176:     ChunkedBody = "1a; ignore-stuff-here" ++ ?CRLF ++ 
  177: 	"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz" ++ ?CRLF ++ "10"  ++ ?CRLF 
  178: 	++ "1234567890abcdef" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "0" ++ ?CRLF 
  179: 	++ "some-footer:some-value"  ++ ?CRLF 
  180: 	++ "another-footer:another-value" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF,
  181: 
  182:     {ok, {Headers, Body}} = 
  183:     http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  184: 		      ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  185:     
  186:     %% There is no guaranteed order of headers.
  187:     true = lists:member("content-length:42", Headers),
  188:     true = lists:member("some-footer:some-value", Headers),
  189:     true = lists:member("another-footer:another-value", Headers),
  190:     "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz1234567890abcdef"  = binary_to_list(Body), 
  191: 
  192:     ChunkedBody1 = "1a" ++ ?CRLF ++ 
  193: 	"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz" ++ ?CRLF ++ "10"  ++ ?CRLF 
  194: 	++ "1234567890abcdef" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "0" ++ ?CRLF
  195: 	++ "some-footer:some-value"  ++ ?CRLF  ++ ?CRLF,
  196:     
  197:     {ok, {Headers1, Body1}} = 
  198: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody1),
  199: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  200:     
  201:     true = lists:member("content-length:42", Headers1),
  202:     true = lists:member("some-footer:some-value", Headers1),
  203:     false = lists:member("another-footer:another-value", Headers1),
  204:     "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz1234567890abcdef"  = binary_to_list(Body1), 
  205: 
  206: 
  207:     ChunkedBody2 = ["1a", ?CRLF ++ 
  208: 		    "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz" ++ ?CRLF ++ "10"  ++ ?CRLF 
  209: 		    ++ "1234567890abcdef" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "0", ";", 
  210: 		    "ignore stuff here=foobar", ?CRLF ++
  211: 		    "some-footer:some-value", ?CRLF, ?CRLF],
  212:       
  213:      {Module, Function, Args} = 
  214:  	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(hd(ChunkedBody2)),
  215:  			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  216:     
  217:      {_, NewBody} = parse(Module, Function, Args, tl(ChunkedBody2)),
  218:      "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz1234567890abcdef" = binary_to_list(NewBody),
  219:    
  220:     ChunkedBody3 = ["1a", ?CRLF ++ 
  221: 		    "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz", ?CRLF ++ "10"  ++  ?CRLF
  222: 		    ++ "1234567890abcdef" ++  ?CRLF ++ "0" ++ ?CRLF 
  223: 		    ++ "some-footer:some-value", [?CR], [?LF] , ?CRLF],
  224:     
  225:      {Module1, Function1, Args1} = 
  226:  	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(hd(ChunkedBody3)),
  227:  			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  228:     
  229:      {_, NewBody} = parse(Module1, Function1, Args1, tl(ChunkedBody3)),
  230:      "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz1234567890abcdef" = binary_to_list(NewBody).
  231: 
  232: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  233: chunk_encode() ->
  234:     [{doc, "Test http_chunk:encode/1 & http_chunk:encode_last/0"}].
  235: chunk_encode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  236:     <<54, ?CR, ?LF, 102,111,111,98,97,114, ?CR, ?LF>> = 
  237: 	http_chunk:encode(list_to_binary("foobar")),
  238:     ["6", ?CR, ?LF,"foobar", ?CR, ?LF] = http_chunk:encode("foobar"),
  239:     <<$0, ?CR, ?LF, ?CR, ?LF >> = http_chunk:encode_last().
  240: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  241: chunk_max_headersize() ->
  242:     [{doc, "Test max header limit"}].
  243: chunk_max_headersize(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  244:     ChunkedBody = "1a; ignore-stuff-here" ++ ?CRLF ++ 
  245: 	"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz" ++ ?CRLF ++ "10"  ++ ?CRLF 
  246: 	++ "1234567890abcdef" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "0" ++ ?CRLF 
  247: 	++ "some-footer:some-value"  ++ ?CRLF 
  248: 	++ "another-footer:another-value" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF,
  249:     
  250:     {ok, {_, _}} = 
  251: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  252: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  253:     
  254:     %% Too long in length header
  255:     {error,{header_too_long, {max, 1}}} = 
  256: 	(catch http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  257: 				 ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, 1)),
  258:     
  259:     %% Too long in extension field
  260:     {error,{header_too_long, {max, 10}}} = 
  261: 	(catch http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  262: 				 ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, 10)),
  263:     
  264:     %% Too long in trailer
  265:     {error,{header_too_long, {max, 30}}} = 
  266: 	(catch http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  267: 				 ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, 30)).
  268: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  269: chunk_not_hex() ->
  270:     [{doc, "Test bad chunked length header"}].
  271: chunk_not_hex(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  272:      ChunkedBody = "åäö; ignore-stuff-here" ++ ?CRLF ++ 
  273: 	"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz" ++ ?CRLF ++ "10"  ++ ?CRLF 
  274: 	++ "1234567890abcdef" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "0" ++ ?CRLF 
  275: 	++ "some-footer:some-value"  ++ ?CRLF 
  276: 	++ "another-footer:another-value" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF,
  277:      {error,{chunk_size, "åäö"}} = 
  278: 	(catch http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  279: 				 ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE)).
  280: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  281: chunk_max_bodysize() ->
  282:     [{doc, "Test max body limit"}].
  283: chunk_max_bodysize(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  284:      ChunkedBody = "1a; ignore-stuff-here" ++ ?CRLF ++ 
  285: 	"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz" ++ ?CRLF ++ "10"  ++ ?CRLF 
  286: 	++ "1234567890abcdef" ++ ?CRLF  ++ "0" ++ ?CRLF 
  287: 	++ "some-footer:some-value"  ++ ?CRLF 
  288: 	++ "another-footer:another-value" ++ ?CRLF ++ ?CRLF,
  289:     {ok, {_, _}} = 
  290: 	http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  291: 			  ?HTTP_MAX_BODY_SIZE, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE),
  292:     
  293:     %% Too long body
  294:     {error,{body_too_big, {max, 10}}} = 
  295: 	 (catch http_chunk:decode(list_to_binary(ChunkedBody),
  296: 				  10, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE)).
  297: 
  298: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  299: http_response() ->
  300:     [{doc, "Test httpc_response:parse*. This test case will simulate that the "
  301:      "message will be received a little at the time on a socket and the "
  302:      "package may be broken up into smaller parts at arbitrary point."}].
  303: http_response(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304: 
  305:     HttpHead1 = ["HTTP", "/1.1 ", "20", "0 ", "ok", [?CR, ?LF], 
  306: 		 "content-length:83" ++ ?CRLF ++ "content", "-type:", 
  307: 		 "text/html" ++ ?CRLF ++  
  308: 		 "date:Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT" ++ 
  309: 		 [?CR], [?LF, ?CR, ?LF]], 
  310:     {"HTTP/1.1",
  311:      200,
  312:      "ok",
  313:      #http_response_h{'content-length' = "83",
  314: 		      'content-type' = "text/html",
  315: 		      date = "Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT"},
  316:      <<>>} =
  317: 	parse(httpc_response, parse, [?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE, false],
  318: 	      HttpHead1),
  319: 
  320:     HttpHead2 = ["HTTP/1.1 200", " ok", [?CR], [?LF] ++ 
  321: 		 "content-length:83" ++ ?CRLF ++ "content-type:", 
  322: 		 "text/html" ++ ?CRLF ++  
  323: 		 "date:" ++ "Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT" ++ 
  324: 		 ?CRLF, ?CRLF], 
  325:     {"HTTP/1.1",
  326:      200,
  327:      "ok",
  328:      #http_response_h{'content-length' = "83",
  329: 		      'content-type' = "text/html",
  330: 		      date = "Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT"},
  331:      <<>>} =
  332: 	parse(httpc_response, parse, [?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE, false], 
  333: 	      HttpHead2),
  334: 
  335:     HttpHead3 = ["HTTP/1.1 200 ", "ok", ?CRLF ++ 
  336: 		 "content-length:83" ++ ?CRLF ++ "content-type:", 
  337: 		 "text/html" ++ ?CRLF ++  
  338: 		 "date:" ++ "Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT" ++ 
  339: 		 [?CR, ?LF,?CR], [?LF]], 
  340:     {"HTTP/1.1",
  341:      200,
  342:      "ok",
  343:      #http_response_h{'content-length' = "83",
  344: 		      'content-type' = "text/html",
  345: 		      date = "Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT"},
  346:      <<>>} =
  347: 	parse(httpc_response, parse, [?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE, false], 
  348: 	      HttpHead3),
  349:     
  350:     HttpBody = ["<HTML>\n<HEAD>\n<TITLE> dummy </TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n<BODY>\n",
  351: 		"<H1>dummy</H1>\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n"],
  352:     
  353:     NewBody = lists:flatten(HttpBody), 
  354:     Length = length(NewBody),
  355:     NewBody = 
  356: 	binary_to_list(parse
  357: 		       (httpc_response, whole_body, [<<>>,Length], 
  358: 			HttpBody)),
  359: 
  360:     HttpBody1 = ["<HTML", ">\n<HEAD>", "\n<TITLE> dummy </TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n",
  361: 		 "<BODY>\n", "<H1>du", "mmy</H1>\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n"],
  362: 
  363:     NewBody1 = lists:flatten(HttpBody1),
  364:     Length1 = length(NewBody1),
  365:     NewBody1 = binary_to_list(parse
  366: 			      (httpc_response, whole_body,
  367: 			       [<<>>,Length1], HttpBody1)),
  368:     ok.
  369: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  370: http_request() ->
  371:     [{doc, "Test httpd_request:parse* This test case will simulate that the " 
  372:      "message will be received a little at the time on a socket and the " 
  373:       "package may be broken up into smaller parts at arbitrary point."}].
  374: http_request(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375: 
  376:     HttpHead = ["GE", "T ", "http://www.erlang", ".org ", "HTTP", 
  377: 		"/1.1" ++ ?CRLF ++ "host:", 
  378: 		"www.erlang.org" ++ [?CR], 
  379: 		[?LF] ++ "te: " ++ ?CRLF, ?CRLF], 
  380:     {"GET",
  381:      "http://www.erlang.org",
  382:      "HTTP/1.1",
  383:      {#http_request_h{host = "www.erlang.org", te = []},
  384:       [{"te", []}, {"host", "www.erlang.org"}]}, <<>>} =
  385: 	parse(httpd_request, parse, [[{max_header, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE},
  386: 				      {max_version, ?HTTP_MAX_VERSION_STRING}, 
  387: 				      {max_method, ?HTTP_MAX_METHOD_STRING},
  388: 				      {max_content_length, ?HTTP_MAX_CONTENT_LENGTH}
  389: 				     ]],
  390: 	      HttpHead),
  391: 
  392:     HttpHead1 = ["GET http://www.erlang.org HTTP/1.1" ++ 
  393: 		 [?CR], [?LF, ?CR, ?LF]],
  394:     {"GET",
  395:      "http://www.erlang.org",
  396:      "HTTP/1.1",
  397:      {#http_request_h{}, []}, <<>>} =
  398: 	parse(httpd_request, parse,  [[{max_header, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE},
  399: 				       {max_version, ?HTTP_MAX_VERSION_STRING}, 
  400: 				       {max_method, ?HTTP_MAX_METHOD_STRING},
  401: 				       {max_content_length, ?HTTP_MAX_CONTENT_LENGTH}
  402: 				      ]], HttpHead1),
  403: 
  404: 
  405:     HttpHead2 = ["GET http://www.erlang.org HTTP/1.1" ++ 
  406: 		 [?CR, ?LF, ?CR], [?LF]],
  407:     {"GET",
  408:      "http://www.erlang.org",
  409:      "HTTP/1.1",
  410:      {#http_request_h{}, []}, <<>>} =
  411: 	parse(httpd_request, parse, [[{max_header, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE},
  412: 				      {max_version, ?HTTP_MAX_VERSION_STRING}, 
  413: 				      {max_method, ?HTTP_MAX_METHOD_STRING},
  414: 				      {max_content_length, ?HTTP_MAX_CONTENT_LENGTH}
  415: 				     ]], HttpHead2),
  416: 
  417:     %% If ?CR is is missing RFC2616 section-19.3
  418:     HttpHead3 = ["GET http://www.erlang.org HTTP/1.1", [?LF],
  419:                  "Accept: text/html", [?LF, ?LF]],
  420:     {"GET",
  421:      "http://www.erlang.org",
  422:      "HTTP/1.1",
  423:      {#http_request_h{}, [{"accept","text/html"}]}, <<>>} =
  424: 	parse(httpd_request, parse, [[{max_header, ?HTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE},
  425: 				      {max_version, ?HTTP_MAX_VERSION_STRING},
  426: 				      {max_method, ?HTTP_MAX_METHOD_STRING},
  427: 				      {max_content_length, ?HTTP_MAX_CONTENT_LENGTH}
  428: 				     ]], HttpHead3),
  429: 
  430:     %% Note the following body is not related to the headers above
  431:     HttpBody = ["<HTML>\n<HEAD>\n<TITLE> dummy </TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n<BODY>\n",
  432: 		"<H1>dummy</H1>\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n"],
  433: 
  434:     NewBody = lists:flatten(HttpBody),
  435:     Length = length(NewBody),
  436:     NewBody = 
  437: 	binary_to_list(parse
  438: 		       (httpd_request, whole_body, [<<>>,Length], HttpBody)),
  439: 
  440:     HttpBody1 = ["<HTML", ">\n<HEAD>", "\n<TITLE> dummy </TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n",
  441: 		 "<BODY>\n", "<H1>du", "mmy</H1>\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n"],
  442: 
  443:     NewBody1 = lists:flatten(HttpBody1), 
  444:     Length1 = length(NewBody1),
  445:     NewBody1 = 	
  446: 	binary_to_list(parse
  447: 		       (httpd_request, whole_body, 
  448: 			[<<>>, Length1], HttpBody1)).
  449: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  450: validate_request_line() ->
  451:     [{doc, "Test httpd_request:validate/3. Makes sure you cannot get past"
  452:      " the server_root and that the request is recognized by the server"
  453:      " and protocol version."}].
  454: validate_request_line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  455: 
  456:     %% HTTP/0.9 not supported
  457:     {error, {bad_version, "HTTP/0.9"}} = 
  458: 	httpd_request:validate("GET", "http://www.erlang/org", "HTTP/0.9"),
  459:     {error, {bad_version, "HTTP/0.9"}} =
  460: 	httpd_request:validate("HEAD", "http://www.erlang/org", "HTTP/0.9"),
  461:     {error, {bad_version, "HTTP/0.9"}} =
  462: 	httpd_request:validate("TRACE", "http://www.erlang/org", "HTTP/0.9"),
  463:     {error, {bad_version, "HTTP/0.9"}} =
  464: 	httpd_request:validate("POST", "http://www.erlang/org", "HTTP/0.9"),
  465: 
  466:     %% HTTP/1.* 
  467:     {ok, "http://www.erlang/org"} = httpd_request:validate("HEAD", "http://www.erlang/org", 
  468: 			       "HTTP/1.1"),
  469:     {ok, "http://www.erlang/org"} = httpd_request:validate("GET", "http://www.erlang/org", 
  470: 			       "HTTP/1.1"),  
  471:     {ok, "http://www.erlang/org"} = httpd_request:validate("POST","http://www.erlang/org", 
  472: 			       "HTTP/1.1"),
  473:     {ok, "http://www.erlang/org"} = httpd_request:validate("TRACE","http://www.erlang/org",
  474:                                                            "HTTP/1.1"),
  475:     {error, {not_supported, 
  476: 	     {"FOOBAR", "http://www.erlang/org", "HTTP/1.1"}}} =
  477: 	httpd_request:validate("FOOBAR", "http://www.erlang/org", 
  478: 			       "HTTP/1.1"),
  479:     %%% Will work after normalization
  480:     Uri = "http://127.0.0.1:8888/../../../../../etc/passwd",
  481:     {ok, "http://127.0.0.1:8888/etc/passwd"} = httpd_request:validate("GET", Uri, "HTTP/1.1"),
  482: 
  483:     Uri2 = 
  484: 	"http://127.0.0.1:8888/././././././../../../../../etc/passwd",
  485:     {ok, "http://127.0.0.1:8888/etc/passwd"} = httpd_request:validate("GET", Uri2, "HTTP/1.1"),
  486: 
  487:     HexUri = "http://127.0.0.1:8888/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/" 
  488: 	"home/foobar/test.html",
  489:     {ok, "http://127.0.0.1:8888/home/foobar/test.html"}  = httpd_request:validate("GET", HexUri, "HTTP/1.1"),
  490: 
  491:     NewUri = 
  492: 	"http://127.0.0.1:8888/foobar/../../../home/foobar/test.html",
  493:     {ok,"http://127.0.0.1:8888/home/foobar/test.html"} = httpd_request:validate("GET", NewUri, "HTTP/1.1"),
  494:     
  495:     Uri1 = 
  496: 	"http://127.0.0.1:8888/../home/foobar/test.html",
  497:     {ok,"http://127.0.0.1:8888/home/foobar/test.html"}  = httpd_request:validate("GET", Uri1, "HTTP/1.1").
  498: 
  499: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  500: check_content_length_encoding() ->
  501:     [{doc, "Test http_request:headers/2. Check that the content-length is"
  502:       " encoded even when it is zero."}].
  503: check_content_length_encoding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  504: 
  505:     %% Check that the content-length is preserved.
  506:     %% Sanity check.
  507:     Header1 = http_request:http_headers(#http_request_h{'content-length'="123"}),
  508:     true = (string:str(Header1, "content-length: 123\r\n") > 0),
  509:     %% Check that content-length=0 is handled correctly.
  510:     Header2 = http_request:http_headers(#http_request_h{'content-length'="0"}),
  511:     true = (string:str(Header2, "content-length: 0\r\n") > 0).
  512: 
  513: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  514: esi_parse_headers() ->
  515:     [{doc, "Test httpd_esi:*. All header values are received in the same"
  516:       " erlang message."}].
  517: esi_parse_headers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  518: 
  519:     ESIResult = "content-type:text/html\r\ndate:Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 "
  520:  	"GMT\r\nstatus:200 OK\r\n\r\nFoobar",
  521:     
  522:     {"content-type:text/html\r\ndate:Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT\r\nst"
  523:      "atus:200 OK\r\n" = Headers,
  524:      "Foobar"} = httpd_esi:parse_headers(ESIResult),
  525:     
  526:     {ok,[{"date","Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT"},
  527: 	 {"content-type","text/html"}], 200} = 
  528: 	httpd_esi:handle_headers(Headers),
  529:     
  530:     ESIResult2 = 
  531: 	"location:http://foo.bar.se\r\ndate:Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 "
  532: 	"GMT\r\n\r\n",
  533:     
  534:     {"location:http://foo.bar.se\r\ndate:Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT\r\n" = 
  535:      Headers2,[]}
  536: 	= httpd_esi:parse_headers(ESIResult2),
  537:     
  538:     {ok,[{"date","Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT"},
  539: 	 {"location","http://foo.bar.se"}], 302} =
  540: 	httpd_esi:handle_headers(Headers2),
  541:     
  542:    {ok,[{"location","/foo/bar.html"}], 302} = 
  543: 	httpd_esi:handle_headers("location:/foo/bar.html\r\n"),
  544:     
  545:     {ok,[{"location","http://foo/bar.html"}],201} =
  546:         httpd_esi:handle_headers("status:201 Created\r\nlocation:http://foo/bar.html\r\n").
  547: 
  548: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  549: cgi_parse_headers() ->
  550:     [{doc, "Test httpd_cgi:*. This test case will simulate that the "
  551:      "message will be received a little at the time on a socket and the "
  552:      "package may be broken up into smaller parts at arbitrary point."}].
  553: 
  554: cgi_parse_headers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  555: 
  556:     CGIResult = ["content-type:text", "/html\ndate:Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 "
  557: 		 "GMT\nst", "atus:200 OK\n", "\nFoobar"],
  558: 
  559:     {Headers, Body} = 
  560: 	parse(httpd_cgi, parse_headers, [<<>>, [], []], CGIResult),
  561:     
  562:     "Foobar" = binary_to_list(Body),
  563: 
  564:     {ok,[{"content-type","text/html"},
  565: 	 {"date","Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT"}], {200,"OK"}}  = 
  566: 	httpd_cgi:handle_headers(Headers),
  567: 
  568:     CGIResult2 = ["location:http://foo.bar.se\ndate:Thu, 28 Oct 2004"
  569: 		  " 07:57:43 GMT\n\n"],
  570:     {Headers2,  _} = parse(httpd_cgi, parse_headers, 
  571: 			   [<<>>, [], []], CGIResult2),
  572: 
  573:     {ok,[{"location","http://foo.bar.se"},
  574: 	 {"date","Thu, 28 Oct 2004 07:57:43 GMT"}], {302,"Redirect"}} =
  575: 	httpd_cgi:handle_headers(Headers2),
  576:     
  577:     {proceed,"/foo/bar.html"} = 
  578: 	httpd_cgi:handle_headers(["location:/foo/bar.html\n"]),
  579: 
  580:     CGIHTTPResult = ["Content-Type:text", "/html\n", "Connection:close\r\n",
  581: 		     "Content-Language:en\r\nAge:", "4711\r\n\r\n\nfoobar"],
  582: 
  583:     {Headers3,  _} = parse(httpd_cgi, parse_headers, 
  584: 			   [<<>>, [], []], CGIHTTPResult),
  585: 
  586:     {ok,[{"content-type","text/html"},
  587: 	 {"connection","close"},
  588: 	 {"content-language","en"},
  589: 	 {"age","4711"}], {200,"ok"}}  = httpd_cgi:handle_headers(Headers3).    
  590: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  591: is_absolut_uri() ->
  592:     [{doc, "Test http_request:is_absolut_uri/1."}].
  593: is_absolut_uri(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  594:     true = http_request:is_absolut_uri("http://www.erlang.org"),
  595:     true = http_request:is_absolut_uri("https://www.erlang.org"),
  596:     false = http_request:is_absolut_uri("index.html").
  597: 
  598: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  599: convert_netscapecookie_date() ->
  600:     [{doc, "Test http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date/1."}].
  601: convert_netscapecookie_date(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  602:     {{2006,1,6},{8,59,38}} = 
  603: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Mon, 06-Jan-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  604:     {{2006,2, 7},{8,59,38}} = 
  605: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Tue, 07-Feb-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  606:     {{2006,3,8},{8,59,38}} = 
  607: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Wdy, 08-Mar-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  608:     {{2006,4,9},{8,59,38}} = 
  609: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Thu, 09-Apr-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  610:     {{2006,5,10},{8,59,38}} = 
  611: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Fri, 10-May-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  612:     {{2006,6,11},{8,59,38}} = 
  613: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sat, 11-Jun-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  614:     {{2006,7,12},{8,59,38}} = 
  615: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sun, 12-Jul-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  616:     {{2006,8,12},{8,59,38}} = 
  617: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sun, 12-Aug-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  618:     {{2006,9,12},{8,59,38}} = 
  619: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sun, 12-Sep-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  620:     {{2006,10,12},{8,59,38}} = 
  621: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sun, 12-Oct-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  622:     {{2006,11,12},{8,59,38}} = 
  623: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sun, 12-Nov-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  624:     {{2006,12,12},{8,59,38}} = 
  625: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sun, 12-Dec-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  626:     {{2006,12,12},{8,59,38}} = 
  627: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sun 12-Dec-2006 08:59:38 GMT"),
  628:     {{2006,12,12},{8,59,38}} = 
  629: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sun, 12-Dec-06 08:59:38 GMT"),
  630:     {{2006,12,12},{8,59,38}} = 
  631: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Sun 12-Dec-06 08:59:38 GMT"),
  632:     {{2036,1,1},{8,0,1}} = 
  633: 	http_util:convert_netscapecookie_date("Tue Jan 01 08:00:01 2036 GMT").
  634: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  635: %%% Internal functions
  636: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  637: 
  638: parse(Module, Function, Args, [Data | Rest]) ->
  639:     case  Module:Function([list_to_binary(Data) | Args]) of
  640: 	{ok, Result} ->
  641: 	    Result;
  642: 	{NewModule, NewFunction, NewArgs} ->
  643: 	    parse(NewModule, NewFunction, NewArgs, Rest)
  644:     end.
  645: 
  646: 
  647:
